namespace.name: ojb
namespace.usage-description: OJB tags used to generate ojb repository xml metadata and database table definitions.

tag.name: ojb.class
tag.usage-description: The ojb.class tag determines whether the class shall be OJB-persistent which results in repository metadata created for it.

parameter.name: accept-locks
parameter.usage-description: Specifies whether implicit locking should propagate to this class. Currently relevant for the ODMG layer only.

parameter.name: attributes
parameter.usage-description: Contains attributes of the class as name-value pairs (e.g. attributes="name1=value1,name2=value2").

parameter.name: determine-extents
parameter.usage-description: If "true" then the extenting ojb-persistent classes are determined automatically. if not, then they have to be specified using the ojb.extent-class tag.

parameter.name: documentation
parameter.usage-description: Contains documentation on the class.

parameter.name: factory-class
parameter.usage-description: Specifies a factory-class that is to be used instead of a no argument constructor. If the factory-class is specified, the factory-method also must be defined.

parameter.name: factory-method
parameter.usage-description: Specifies a static no-argument method in the class specified by factory-class that will be used for constructing instances.

parameter.name: generate-table-info
parameter.usage-description: Determines whether table info should be generated. Useful when handling abstract base types who should not have their own tables but need to be present in the repository. When no table info is generated then the following attributes of the ojb.class tag are ignored: table, include-inherited. In addition, in the same class and its members the following tags are completely ignored: ojb.field, ojb.reference, ojb.collection, ojb.foreignkey. Note that the member tags will be processed for sub-types with include-inherited set.

parameter.name: include-inherited
parameter.usage-description: If "true" then fields/references/collections of super types are included in the descriptor. This in effect flattens the inheritance hierarchy for the fields.

parameter.name: initialization-method
parameter.usage-description: Specifies an instance method without arguments that is called after an object has been read from the database.

parameter.name: isolation-level
parameter.usage-description: Specifies the transactional isolation to be used for this class on ODMG-level.

parameter.name: proxy
parameter.usage-description: If set, proxies are used for all loading operations of instances of this class. If set to "dynamic", dynamic proxies are used. If set to another value this value is interpreted as the full-qualified name of the proxy class to use.

parameter.name: proxy-prefetching-limit
parameter.usage-description: If set to a value > 0, then collections of objects of this class are materialized by groups of the specified size. Set this parameter to 0 (the default) to turn this feature off.

parameter.name: refresh
parameter.usage-description: The "true" setting forces OJB to refresh instances when loaded from cache.

parameter.name: row-reader
parameter.usage-description: Contains the fully qualified name of the class that will be used as the RowReader implementation for materializing instances of the class.

parameter.name: schema
parameter.usage-description: Contains the database schema owning the table mapped to this class.

parameter.name: table
parameter.usage-description: Specifies the database table name. Default is the unqualified class name.

tag.name: ojb.object-cache
tag.usage-description: The ojb.object-cache tag specifies a class to be used for caching instances of the current class.

parameter.name: attributes
parameter.usage-description: Contains attributes of the object cache as name-value pairs (e.g. attributes="name1=value1,name2=value2").

parameter.name: class
parameter.usage-description: The fully qualified name of the object cache class.

parameter.name: documentation
parameter.usage-description: Contains documentation on the object cache.

tag.name: ojb.extent-class
tag.usage-description: The ojb.extent-class tag specifies a sub type of the current class. The tag is only evaluated if the determine-extents attribute of the ojb.class tag is set to false.

parameter.name: class-ref
parameter.usage-description: The fully qualified name of the sub type.

tag.name: ojb.modify-inherited
tag.usage-description: Allows to override an the tag attributes for an inherited field (e.g. its ojb.field, ojb.reference, or ojb.collection tag).

parameter.name: access
parameter.usage-description: Overrides the access attribute of the field tag.

parameter.name: attributes
parameter.usage-description: Overrides the attributes attribute of the field/reference/collection tag.

parameter.name: autoincrement
parameter.usage-description: Overrides the autoincrement attribute of the field tag.

parameter.name: auto-delete
parameter.usage-description: Overrides the auto-delete attribute of the reference or collection tag.

parameter.name: auto-retrieve
parameter.usage-description: Overrides the auto-retrieve attribute of the reference or collection tag.

parameter.name: auto-update
parameter.usage-description: Overrides the auto-update attribute of the reference or collection tag.

parameter.name: class-ref
parameter.usage-description: Overrides the class-ref attribute of the reference tag.

parameter.name: collection-class
parameter.usage-description: Overrides the collection-class attribute of the collection tag.

parameter.name: column
parameter.usage-description: Overrides the column attribute of the field tag.

parameter.name: conversion
parameter.usage-description: Overrides the conversion attribute of the field tag.

parameter.name: default-fetch
parameter.usage-description: Overrides the default-fetch attribute of the field tag.

parameter.name: documentation
parameter.usage-description: Overrides the documentation attribute of the field/reference/collection tag.

parameter.name: element-class-ref
parameter.usage-description: Overrides the element-class-ref attribute of the collection tag.

parameter.name: foreignkey
parameter.usage-description: Overrides the foreignkey attribute of the reference or collection tag (if not using an indirection table).

parameter.name: id
parameter.usage-description: Overrides the id attribute of the field tag.

parameter.name: indexed
parameter.usage-description: Overrides the indexed attribute of the field tag.

parameter.name: jdbc-type
parameter.usage-description: Overrides the jdbc-type attribute of the field tag.

parameter.name: length
parameter.usage-description: Overrides the length attribute of the field tag.

parameter.name: locking
parameter.usage-description: Overrides the locking attribute of the field tag.

parameter.name: name
parameter.usage-description: Contains the name of the field whose tag attributes shall be modified.

parameter.name: nullable
parameter.usage-description: Overrides the nullable attribute of the field tag.

parameter.name: orderby
parameter.usage-description: Overrides the orderby attribute of the collection tag.

parameter.name: otm-dependent
parameter.usage-description: Overrides the otm-dependent attribute of the reference or collection tag.

parameter.name: precision
parameter.usage-description: Overrides the precision attribute of the field tag.

parameter.name: primarykey
parameter.usage-description: Overrides the primarykey attribute of the field tag.

parameter.name: proxy
parameter.usage-description: Overrides the proxy attribute of the reference or collection tag.

parameter.name: proxy-prefetching-limit
parameter.usage-description: Overrides the proxy-prefetching-limit attribute of the reference or collection tag.

parameter.name: refresh
parameter.usage-description: Overrides the refresh attribute of the reference or collection tag.

parameter.name: scale
parameter.usage-description: Overrides the scale attribute of the field tag.

parameter.name: sequence-name
parameter.usage-description: Overrides the sequence-name attribute of the field tag.

parameter.name: table
parameter.usage-description: Overrides the table attribute of the field tag.

parameter.name: update-lock
parameter.usage-description: Overrides the update-lock attribute of the field tag.

tag.name: ojb.index
tag.usage-description: Declares an index for the class.

parameter.name: documentation
parameter.usage-description: Contains documentation on the index.

parameter.name: fields
parameter.usage-description: Contains the name of the fields that make up this index, separated by commas.

parameter.name: name
parameter.usage-description: Contains the name of this index.

parameter.name: unique
parameter.usage-description: Specifies whether the index is unique or not.

tag.name: ojb.field
tag.usage-description: The ojb.field tag specifies a field that is persistent with OJB. The tag is applicable to both fields and methods, more specifically, accessor methods (get/set/is). In the latter case, the field descriptor is generated for the corresponding bean property.

parameter.name: access
parameter.usage-description: Specifies the accessibility of the field (readonly or modifiable).

parameter.name: attributes
parameter.usage-description: Contains attributes of the field as name-value pairs (e.g. attributes="name1=value1,name2=value2").

parameter.name: autoincrement
parameter.usage-description: Specifies whether the values for the persistent field are automatically generated by OJB/the database.

parameter.name: column
parameter.usage-description: Specifies the column the persistent classes field is mapped to. If not given, then the name of the field/property is used.

parameter.name: conversion
parameter.usage-description: Contains a fully qualified name of a class implementing org.apache.ojb.accesslayer.conversions.FieldConversion. A FieldConversion can be used to implement conversions between Java-Types and database columns. Note that the conversion is only determined automatically by xdoclet when the default jdbc type is used. When a jdbc type is explicitly specified, then a conversion needs to specified if desired.

parameter.name: default-fetch
parameter.usage-description: Specifies whether the persistent attribute belongs to the JDO default fetch group. Is thus only relevant when using JDO with OJB.

parameter.name: documentation
parameter.usage-description: Contains documentation on the field.

parameter.name: id
parameter.usage-description: If specified, it specifies the position of the field in the sequence of fields. Otherwise, OJB uses the order of appearance of fields. The order of the numbers for the fields must correspond to the order of columns in the mapped table.

parameter.name: indexed
parameter.usage-description: Specifies whether there is an index on the column for the field.

parameter.name: jdbc-type
parameter.usage-description: Specifies the JDBC type of the column. If not given, then the default mapping for the java type of the field is used.

parameter.name: length
parameter.usage-description: Can be used to specify a length setting if required by the jdbc-type of the underlying database column.

parameter.name: locking
parameter.usage-description: Is set to true if the persistent attribute is used for optimistic locking. Can only be set for TIMESTAMP and INTEGER columns.

parameter.name: name
parameter.usage-description: Contains the name when this ojb.field tag is in the class' javadoc comment, i.e. if it specifies an anonymous field. Otherwise, the value of this attribute is ignored.

parameter.name: nullable
parameter.usage-description: Specifies whether the column for the field may contain null values.

parameter.name: precision
parameter.usage-description: Can be used to specify a precision setting if required by the jdbc-type of the underlying database column.

parameter.name: primarykey
parameter.usage-description: Specifies whether the column for the field is a primary key column.

parameter.name: scale
parameter.usage-description: Can be used to specify a scale setting if required by the jdbc-type of the underlying database column.

parameter.name: sequence-name
parameter.usage-description: Can be used to state explicitly a sequence name used by the sequence manager implementations (relevant when using autoincrement).

parameter.name: table
parameter.usage-description: May specify a table different from the mapped table for the persistent class (currently not implemented in OJB).

parameter.name: update-lock
parameter.usage-description: Is set to false if the persistent attribute is used for optimistic locking and the database should update the lock column itself. The default is true (when locking is true then OJB will update the locking fields). Note that this can only be set for TIMESTAMP and INTEGER columns.

tag.name: ojb.reference
tag.usage-description: The ojb.reference tag specifies a 1:1 association to another OJB-persistent type. The tag is applicable to both fields and methods, more specifically, accessor methods (get/set/is). In the latter case, a reference descriptor for the bean property is generated.

parameter.name: attributes
parameter.usage-description: Contains attributes of the reference as name-value pairs (e.g. attributes="name1=value1,name2=value2").

parameter.name: auto-delete
parameter.usage-description: Specifies whether OJB automatically deletes this reference attribute on deleting the persistent object. This attribute must be set to false if using the OTM, ODMG or JDO layer.

parameter.name: auto-retrieve
parameter.usage-description: Specifies whether OJB automatically retrieves this reference attribute on loading the persistent object. If set to false the reference attribute is set to null. In this case the user is responsible to fill the reference attribute.

parameter.name: auto-update
parameter.usage-description: Specifies whether OJB automatically stores this reference attribute on storing the persistent object. This attribute must be set to false if using the OTM, ODMG or JDO layer.

parameter.name: class-ref
parameter.usage-description: Allows to explicitly specify which type is referenced (useful mostly when dealing with proxies). If not given then the type of the member and subtypes of it are searched for the first type that has the ojb.class tag.

parameter.name: documentation
parameter.usage-description: Contains documentation on the reference.

parameter.name: foreignkey
parameter.usage-description: Contains one or more foreignkeys (separated by commas) which are fields in the same class implementing the association.

parameter.name: name
parameter.usage-description: Contains the name when this ojb.reference tag is in the class' javadoc comment, i.e. if it specifies an anonymous reference. Otherwise, the value of this attribute is ignored.

parameter.name: otm-dependent
parameter.usage-description: Specifies whether the OTM layer automatically creates the referred object and deletes it if the reference field is set to null.

parameter.name: proxy
parameter.usage-description: Specifies that proxy based lazy loading should be used for this attribute. This pertains only to the reference, not to the referenced class itself (use the proxy attribute of the ojb.class tag to denote a proxied class).

parameter.name: proxy-prefetching-limit
parameter.usage-description: if set to a value > 0, then loading of the reference for the first object of some collection causes loading of the references for the next proxy-prefetching-limit objects. Set this parameter to 0 (the default) to turn this feature off.

parameter.name: refresh
parameter.usage-description: Forces OJB to refresh object references on instance loading when set to true.

tag.name: ojb.collection
tag.usage-description: Denotes a collection or array field that represents a persistent 1:n or m:n association.

parameter.name: attributes
parameter.usage-description: Contains attributes of the collection as name-value pairs (e.g. attributes="name1=value1,name2=value2").

parameter.name: auto-delete
parameter.usage-description: Specifies whether OJB automatically deletes this collection attribute on deleting the persistent object. This attribute must be set to false if using the OTM, ODMG or JDO layer.

parameter.name: auto-retrieve
parameter.usage-description: Specifies whether OJB automatically retrieves this collection attribute on loading the persistent object. If set to false the reference attribute is set to null. In this case the user is responsible to fill the collection attribute.

parameter.name: auto-update
parameter.usage-description: Specifies whether OJB automatically stores this collection attribute on storing the persistent object. This attribute must be set to false if using the OTM, ODMG or JDO layer.

parameter.name: collection-class
parameter.usage-description: Specifies the collection type that this collection uses. If not given, then the xdoclet ojb module checks whether the type of the collection implements org.apache.ojb.broker.ManageableCollection.

parameter.name: documentation
parameter.usage-description: Contains documentation on the collection.

parameter.name: element-class-ref
parameter.usage-description: Contains the fully qualified class name of the elements of the collection. Note that the type must be OJB-persistent, e.g. it must have the ojb.class. If the field is an array, then the parameter can be omitted when the type of the array elements fulfills this requirement. For collections and arrays of non-OJB-persistent objects, the parameter is required.

parameter.name: foreignkey
parameter.usage-description: Contains one or more foreignkeys (separated by commas). If this collection implements an 1:n association, this is the field in the element class that implements the association. If the collection stands for an m:n association, this parameter contains information on foreign-key columns of the intermediary table.

parameter.name: indirection-table
parameter.usage-description: Specifies the name of the intermediary table if the persistent collection attribute implements a m:n association.

parameter.name: orderby
parameter.usage-description: Specifies the ordering to be used for this collection as name-value pairs, e.g. "column1=ASC,column2,column3=DESC" (the second column uses ascending sorting).

parameter.name: otm-dependent
parameter.usage-description: Specifies whether the OTM layer automatically creates collection elements that were added to the collection and deletes collection elements that were removed from the collection.

parameter.name: proxy
parameter.usage-description: Specifies that proxy based lazy loading should be used for this attribute. This pertains only to the collection, not to the referenced class itself (use the proxy attribute of the ojb.class tag to denote a proxied class).

parameter.name: proxy-prefetching-limit
parameter.usage-description: if set to a value > 0, then loading of the collection for the first object of some other collection causes loading of the collections for the next proxy-prefetching-limit objects. Set this parameter to 0 (the default) to turn this feature off.

parameter.name: query-customizer
parameter.usage-description: Defines the query customizer for this collection.

parameter.name: query-customizer-attributes
parameter.usage-description: Contains attributes for the query-customizer of this collection. Is ignored if no query-customizer is stated.

parameter.name: refresh
parameter.usage-description: Forces OJB to refresh object and collection references on instance loading when set to true.

parameter.name: remote-foreignkey
parameter.usage-description: Contains one or more foreignkeys columns (separated by commas) in the indirection table pointing to the element type. This parameter should only be used if the element type does not have a collection that can be used to get these foreignkeys from.
